title: Non-invasive sound therapy shows promise for Alzheimer’s
summary: 40Hz auditory therapy clears Alzheimer’s-linked proteins in primates, pointing to a low-cost, non-invasive path for brain health. Alzheimer’s does not arrive with drama so much as persistence; the brain’s housekeeping slips, proteins such as beta-amyloid accumulate and communication starts to falter. It is less a sudden catastrophe than a slow systems failure – a city […] The post Non-invasive sound therapy shows promise for Alzheimer’s appeared first on Longevity.Technology.
author: Kyle Umipig
